value: Terrine, pl. 57 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Covered tureen (and stand) with a swirling shape, foliate knob on cover, stand,resting on C-scrolls, has same flowing, fluid lines as the tureen.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Dixieme livre des oeuvres de J.A. Meissonnier, Surtout de Table/Terrine [Tenth Series of Designs from the work of J.A. Meissonnier, Table Centerpiece/Tureen], pl. 61 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Elaborate table centerpiece consisting of central covered urn decorated with two putti, center shell, four candle arms, and two male/animal figures. The plateau shows a symmetrical arrangement of bowls of fruits, cruets, covered dishes interspersed with flowers.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Tureen, from Dixieme Livre des Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonier, plate 62 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Covered tureen on stand. Cover is dominated by a large crayfish, a snail and oak leaves. The body of the tureen and stand are composed of swirling acanthus leaves and shell motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on off- white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Differents Desseins de Sallieres [Various Designs for Salt Dishes], pl. 63 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Five designs for open salt cellars, each has asymmetrical arrangement with predominantly shell motifs, placed on three levels of platforms.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Covered tureen, knob on lid in shape of a large artichoke with descending leaves. Body of tureen shows central cartouche with royal crown on top. Cascades of flowers flank the cartouche. Tureen has two handles.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Projet de grand Chandelier à branche pour le Roy., Chandelier à cinq branches avec un dragon, 2nd Plate

label: Description
value: Candelabra with five arms decorated with acanthus leaves, a putto leaning out from the stem, a dragon below, set on a base with a central cartouche.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
CINQUIEME LIVRE D'ORNAMENS Inventés Par J.A. Meissonnier et Gravé par Huquier

label: Description
value: Large cartouche in which "CINQUIEME/LIVRE D'ORNAMENS/Inventés/Par J.A. Meissonnier/et/Gravé par Huquier" is written. The cartouche is decorated with a shell motif on top, dragons descending either side and the sea with two sailing vessels. The horizon and sky are in the background.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Girandolle à branche de porcelaine garnie d'or (Girandolle with Porcelain Branches Covered in Gold), plate 69, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Girandolle (calendabrum) on platform; three entwined branches covered in foliage, ending with two floral sockets.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Dousieme livre des oeuvres de J.A. Meissonnier/Livre de Chandeliers de Sculpture en Argent.

label: Description
value: Candelabra with three branches exuberantly decorated with leaves on candleholders, leaves twisting down the body and terminating with a cascade of leaves and flowers that rest on a base.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Candlestick, plate 74, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Candlestick on platform; twisted from bottom up with vegetal forms; a crown-like object sits at center.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Candlestick, plate 75, from Cinquième Livre d'Ornemens, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Candlestick on platform; twisting from bottom to top, curves decorate entire body. Some leaves draped at bottom off platform.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Candlestick exuberantly designed with swirling movement, small floral garland twisting down the body. Candlestick rests on a base which has a shell motif at bottom left.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Croix d'Autel (Cross of the Altar), plate 79, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Design for a cross on footed platform; a seated robed woman holds a tablet to which she points. Above, the body of the cross is fluted and ornamented with four putti heads, clouds and vines, leading up to the cross with an X behind and a crown of thorns.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Ciboire (Ciborium), plate 80, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Container on platform with an escutcheon depicting Crucifixion; two putti put arms around stem of container; central body of stem made up of two putti heads surrounded by feathery foliage, leading up to the cup that depicts a scene of the last supper, framed in rococo style and flanked by two angels. Lid has wheat, grapevines and is topped with two putti heads gazing up at a cross.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Chandelier d'Eglise (Church Chandelier), plate 81, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Footed lamp in rococo style; main body shows cross with what look like rays. Above, two putti heads gaze downward; above, lamp is in a roughly triangular shape, made up of C-curves leading upward to a bowl-like element topped with a point.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Mansarde, Maison du Sieur Léon Brethous (Attic Floor Plan of Léon Brethous House), plate 9, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works of Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Architectural plan with alphabetical notations identifying rooms [in French].

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Entresol, Maison du Sieur Léon Brethous (Mezzanine Floor Plan of Léon Brethous House), plate 6, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works of Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Architectural plan with alphabetical notations identifying rooms [in French].

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Rez de Chaussée (Ground Floor), Maison du Sieur Léon Brethous (Ground Floor Plan of Léon Brethous House), plate 5, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works of Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Architectural plan with alphabetical notations identifying rooms [in French].

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Vüe de Même (Czartoryski) Sallon du Costé des Glacés (Design for the Salon Czartoryski), plate 85, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Symmetrical view of interior decoration with four mirrors and central double doors. Each mirror and door decorated with overhanging. Left: two putti in rocaille frame, one playing lute; second from left: group of ladies sitting in a trompe l'oeil balcony as though at the theater; central overhanging: two classical female figures flank empty crowned cartouche; right of center: three formally-dressed ladies in trompe l'oeil balcony; far right: two putti, one with bow and arrow with boar. Each mirror is heavily decorated with shells, leaves and two or four candles.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Vuë du même Sallon par le bout des Sophites (View of the Same Salon), plate 86, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Salon decoration includes putti, C-curves; trompe l'oeil with cartouche and portrait of a woman held and surrounded by putti, flowers, rocaille; below this, shell over door which is flanked by two mirrors; left, three chairs, right, a settee.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Cabinet de Mr. le Comte Bielenski (sic), Grand Maréchal de la Couronne de Pologne executé en 1734; Chiminée avec glace, avec de chaque côté une partie du lambris d'appui et des peintures, 1st Plate, plate 87 in l'Oeuvre de Juste Aurèle Meissonier, Paris, 1748

label: Description
value: Large-scale drawing of fireplace with andirons in foreground and cartouche decoration at rear of opening. The overmantel consists of a large rococo mirror which reflects the other side of the room. Three-branched wall lights are attached to either side of the mirror. At top of mirror, near ceiling, are two putti playing with garland flowers. Enclosed in a paneled frame (left) is a partial view of a painting, "Zephyr et Flore," showing putti, flowers, and the legs of a goddess. A putto, holding a flamed torch, is at top of painting. In the paneled frame (right) is a partial view of a man holding a spear in his right hand with two dogs nearby.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Vue de l'angle du même Cabinet; Vue de l'angle du même cabinet, montrant à gauche une grande fenêtre et à droite le tableau de Zéphyr et Flore, 2nd Plate, plate 88 in L'Oeuvre de Juste Aurèle Meissonnier, Paris, 1748

label: Description
value: Large-scale drawing of a corner angle of Count Bielinski's Cabinet (1941-6-212-45), showing a window at left and a full-view painting of Zephyr and Flore at right. The painted shows a winged Zephyr holding the chin of Flore, surrounded with putti and garlands of flowers.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Vue des trumeaux du même Cabinet; Vue des trumeaux du même Cabinet, 3rd Plate

label: Description
value: Detail of Count Bielinski's cabinet (1921-6-212-45). Elevation showing a reflecting pier mirror with a wall-mounted console table below. To the left, a scene of steps, tall pillars, a large urn and leafy trees is seen through the window. To the right, a tall boiserie panel decorated at the center with a winged angel blowing a horn.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: 2nd state. Central cartouche panel, surrounded by rockwork motif with iris on left and tulip(?) on right, consisting of a still life at center composed of shells, plants, coral, branches, leaves, snail shells, and lilies.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Development de l'entresol et du premier Etage.

label: Description
value: 1st state. Section of building, mezzanine floor showing side chairs, wall clock (left side), mirrors, and fireplaces. First floor showing boiserie panels with figural carvings, mirrors, fireplaces, and side chairs.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Developments du second et troisieme Etage.

label: Description
value: 1st state. Second floor showing fireplace and mirror flanked with candelabra, wall clock, side chairs (left side), daybed with draped curtain and valance, painting on wall, fireplace with mirror, side chairs (right side).

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 3, Developement d'un Trumeau de glace fait pour le Portugal (Design for a Pier Glass with Varation for Portugal), Oeuvre de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works of Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: A variation of "le Portugal" wall decoration and pier mirror showing a tall center pier mirror flanked with candelabra, rococo console, and table below. On wall at left, a wall bracket with a large covered vase at top, two small covered vases below, and a mask. At right, a wall bracket with nude male bearded figure holding a sheaf of wheat (?).

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Projet du Plafond d'une Maison seise rue de Rochouard (Design for Ceiling of the House of Francois Petit), plate 95, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Trompe l'oeil effect, view of sky through opening, which is surrounded by putti, a painter with a canvas and easel; putti hold astronomical drawings and use astronomy instruments; at center, in sky, a robed and crowned figure.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Projet d'une grande Pendule placée sur un paneau (Design for a Pendulum Clock Placed on a Panel), plate 97, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Pendulum clock on a panel, suspended by a vine; a winged female figure, holding a bundle of flowers and leaves, sits atop clock; left, a standing putto and below a female figure seen from the back, engulfed by wave-like elements, gazes upward. On right, partial mirror; left, partial door.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cadran à Vent de Me le Duc de Mortemart en 1724 (Design for a Barometer for the Duc of Mortemart in 1724), plate 98, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Barometer at center topped with female figure with raised right arm, clouds around her.  Barometer's inscription: NORD; EST; OUEST; SUD. Below three nude figures, one pours liquid contents of amphora into rocaille formation below sitting on platform. Left, wall; right, window.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Projet d'un Tombeau fait pour Mr. le President de la * * * * * à Dijon en 1733 (Design for a Tomb for President * * * * * in Dijon in 1733), plate 99, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: tomb with two central figures, one reclined on rocaille formation, with right hand on head, left hand holding had of second figure who leans over and holds a book upright in his right hand. tombe topped with two putti and urn; standing putto holds head in hand, while seated putto engraves urn. Architectural indoor background with window behind tomb and columns on either side.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
